pullRequest.body:
## Skew Monoid algebras
This file presents a skewed version of `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Basic` with an **irreducible** definition.

## Context
Hi everyone,
As a part of a bigger project aiming to get [Drinfeld Modules](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drinfeld_module) into Mathlib, @**María Inés de Frutos Fernández**  and I have been trying to get a generalization of `MonoidAlgebra`, `SkewMonoidAlgebra`, into Mathlib. The first attempt at this was #10541, but progress has been slow as making the definition irreducible caused a huge refactor.

Following @kbuzzard's [suggestion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60SkewMonoidAlgebra.60.20and.20the.20separation.20with.20.60Finsupp.60/near/456861000), I am opening this PR which contains only the first 160 lines of #10541. In particular, this PR is missing most of what makes these objects skewed (Multiplication was defined only at line 558 as it requires stronger hypotheses and there are many lemmas on the additive structure that precede it.) This means that the purpose of this PR is mainly to get the separation from `Finsupp` right.


Please consult this [thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60SkewMonoidAlgebra.60.20and.20the.20separation.20with.20.60Finsupp.60/near/456834154) for more context or in short:

The current separation we have consists of:

1. Wrapping the definition with a structure.
2. Making basic operations such as `add` private and irreducible.
3. Adapting relevant definitions.
4. Copying and adapting relevant theorems from the base construct to obtain statements in terms of our new object.

Is this what everyone has in mind? If so, are there parts of the current PR that come short in respect to any of these?

I am happy to integrate suggestions to improve the separation if there are any!

Thanks a lot for your attention and help!
Xavier

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [b0dfd960eb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15878/commits/b0dfd960eb9599d2f13deb15e5f4a1893fb875b2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.SkewMonoidAlgebra.Basic`|663|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ SkewMonoidAlgebra`
`+ _root_.IsSMulRegular.skewMonoidAlgebra`
`+ eta`
`+ instAdd`
`+ instAddCommMonoid`
`+ instInhabited`
`+ instNontrivial`
`+ instSMulZeroClass`
`+ instZero`
`+ ofFinsupp_add`
`+ ofFinsupp_eq_zero`
`+ ofFinsupp_inj`
`+ ofFinsupp_injective`
`+ ofFinsupp_smul`
`+ ofFinsupp_zero`
`+ support`
`+ support_eq_empty`
`+ support_ofFinsupp`
`+ support_toFinsupp`
`+ support_zero`
`+ toFinsupp_add`
`+ toFinsupp_eq_zero`
`+ toFinsupp_inj`
`+ toFinsupp_injective`
`+ toFinsupp_smul`
`+ toFinsupp_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This is an `irreducible_def` not an `@[irreducible] def`. If there is not kernel performance issues evident, then I much prefer the latter to push maintenance issues to core.

@Ruben-VandeVelde, this has been updated thank you.

@mattrobball, I am a little bit unfamiliar with the [@irreducible] attribute. Where is it defined? In particular, I can't prove `instSMulZeroClass.smul_zero` when I use it.

It is in core Lean. Current practice is to use `unseal foo in` before the declaration if you need to access the definition of `foo` or to use `with_unfolding_all` in tactic mode for steps that require unfolding
LGTM.

Hey everyone, I have requested reviews from the reviewers of #10541.

In particular, @eric-wieser mentioned diamond problems with the irreducibility of `smul` [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1705399772). Is working with `@[irreducible]` instead of irreducible_def fine? (I assume not?) Should I revert this and only have `add` as irreducible?
@eric-wieser What is your feeling about irreducibility of add and smul here?

I am minded to merge this PR (I just left two docstring comments) if we don't hear from Eric within the next few days. My understanding is that we have already discussed all the irreducibility issues.
This looks good to me. I've left some more comments.

I am minded to merge this PR (I just left two docstring comments) if we don't hear from Eric within the next few days. My understanding is that we have already discussed all the irreducibility issues.
Nit: (new) named instances should be `instTypeclass`, e.g. `instZero`
These lines should only be indented two spaces
Please note in the docstring which parts exist at the current state of the file
Why do you use the underscored names? Dtto above.

```suggestion
    exact congr_arg _ <| ha.finsupp (ofFinsupp.inj h)
```

```suggestion
instance instAdd : Add (SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) := ⟨add⟩
```

```suggestion
open Function
```
Why is this (and `smul`) `private`? And why are they irreducible?

I think the idea is that we eventually don't want to be able to reference these definitions unless we really need to. The point of the separation is to forget about the `Finsupp` structure, so we ultimately want to be in a position where we never need to unfold these. That being said, we need to use it a couple time to get there.

This is my understanding of what the separation we are doing means but I could be wrong as to my knowledge there are no clear guidelines.

They are private to hide `Finsupp` (as is done in the current implementation of `Polynomial`); same for the irreducibility of `add`.

I have removed the `irreducible` tag from `smul` since, as @eric-wieser pointed out [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10541#discussion_r1705688680), this causes diamonds. In particular, the following example fails if `smul` is irreducible.
```lean
example {S} [Monoid S] [AddCommMonoid k] [DistribMulAction S k] :
    (Units.instDistribMulAction : DistribMulAction Sˣ (SkewMonoidAlgebra k G)) =
    SkewMonoidAlgebra.distribMulAction := by
  with_reducible_and_instances rfl
```
Why are you naming some universes but not others?
If you hadn't made it irreducible, you wouldn't have to do this!

```suggestion
  /-- The natural map from `G →₀ k` to `SkewMonoidAlgebra k G`. -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- The natural map from `SkewMonoidAlgebra k G` to `G →₀ k`. -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat(SkewMonoidAlgebra): add SkewMonoidAlgebra with irreducible def
